div.p: After the letters were sealed, the following was reported from Augsburg, written on March 25: Alba, the torch of wars, is dead, and the Emperor is again lying down mortally.

With us, soldiers are gathering to be led to garrisons in Italy. Spanish and Italian garrison troops will be placed on ships. The Turkish envoy has come to Vienna, Austria, to request passage for the Turks through Styria. The Emperor has pawned Silesia to Elector Augustus for a huge sum of money. The Poles will convene to elect their king on April 5.

The people of Urbino are said to be reconciling with their prince. The peasants of Carniola were slaughtered by their prince Charles, some impaled on stakes, all cruelly killed; for it is said they were severely punished.
From Heidelberg, Basel, Schaffhausen, etc., it is written: The people of La Rochelle, in a second sortie, inflicted heavy losses on the king's army besieging the city.
The Duke of Aumale was killed, as well as the king's illegitimate brother and many prominent men and leaders, Guise was mortally wounded. The king, a robber, greatly fears for himself.
Philip asked the Emperor to make peace with Uranus. The Dane is gathering soldiers; it is unknown for what purpose.
